Record.Value: Basic UI
Welcome to the Academy, Cadet! It's time to teach you the basics of becoming a Stationeer! In our first lesson, we'll cover the basics of UI and controls.
Where's My Cursor?
Let's get started. Our first task is to take a quick look at the Stationpedia. When you're done, close the Stationpedia using {KEY:Help} or hold the {KEY:MouseControl} key and move the mouse cursor.
Close the {LINK:Home;Stationpedia}
ALERT
Incoming Alert!!!

Cadet, we've detected an imminent malfunction! A virus is attacking your helmet controls! Press the {KEY:Internals} key to close your helmet if it opens. Close this message using the {KEY:MouseControl} key to enable the mouse.
Closing helmet
Close Alert
As a human, you cannot survive on non-oxygen planets without a suit, or a base with a breatheable atmosphere. Be sure to close and lock your helmet to avoid accidental death.
Open your helmet UI with {KEY:HelmetSlot} or use the {KEY:MouseControl} key to interact with your {SLOT:Helmet}.
Close your helmet with {KEY:Internals}
Be sure to lock your helmet to prevent it happening again. Hold the {KEY:MouseControl} key and click the Lock Mask option on the helmet menu.
ALERT
Close Alert
Incoming Alert!!!

Cadet, your suit's control system still appears to be infected with a virus. We are working on it now, but it's attacking your suit's pressure and temperature controls. Close this message using the {KEY:MouseControl} key to enable the mouse.
Is It Cold Out Here?
Open your suit controls with {KEY:SuitSlot} or click the suit icon at left with the {KEY:MouseControl} key. Adjust your suit's internal pressure and temperature using the controls in the suit menu.
Open your Suit UI with {KEY:SuitSlot}
Change your suit's temperature to 22 degrees: hold the {KEY:MouseControl} key for mouse control and click on the 'Temperature Up' option.
Change your suit's internal pressure to 45 pascals by clicking on the Pressure Up option.
Life Support Items

We've almost cleared the virus! However, it has damaged some of your suit's life support equipment. Let's replace them now. We've been granted access to a supply crate. It should have the items you need for basic survival: a battery to power life support systems, and a carbon filter to remove any carbon from your internal atmosphere.
Replace your battery to power life support. Alternatively, drag the item directly from the crate into the suit slot that contains the empty battery.

Add a filter to your suit. Click on the CO2 filter in the crate to move it to your hands. Then move it to your suit by holding the {KEY:MouseControl} key and dragging it over the used CO2 filter, then dropping it into that slot.

Virus Eradicated. Good work, Cadet! Remember, you can close all open UI windows quickly with the {KEY:HideAllWindows} key, or close each window individually by clicking the corresponding slot number for each window.
Closing the menus
Now for the final step. Lets clean up the UI windows.
Close the Alert
Close all the UIs with the {KEY:HideAllWindows} key.
If you have any remaining items in your hands, drop them with the {KEY:Drop} key. To swap hands use the {KEY:SwapHands} key.
